unnormalised: Hey folks, have you seen the overflowing garbage bins lately? Waste management is definitely a hot topic, especially here in Mumbai!
normalised: Hey folks, have you seen the overflowing garbage bins lately? Waste management is definitely a hot topic, especially here in Mumbai!

unnormalised: The IIT Bombay is running some really cool initiatives, trying to figure out how we can better sort our waste at the source. Imagine, less smelly landfills and more recycling!
normalised: The I I T Bombay is running some really cool initiatives, trying to figure out how we can better sort our waste at the source. Imagine, less smelly landfills and more recycling!

unnormalised: Remember that scene in "Lage Raho Munna Bhai" where Munna cleans up the streets? Well, it's inspiring, but we need more than just Gandhigiri. We need systemic changes.
normalised: Remember that scene in "Lage Raho Munna Bhai" where Munna cleans up the streets? Well, it's inspiring, but we need more than just Gandhigiri. We need systemic changes.

unnormalised: The local BMC is piloting a new program in Andheri, focusing on composting wet waste right in the apartment complexes. Apparently, they're even giving residents subsidies to buy composting bins!
normalised: The local B M C is piloting a new program in Andheri, focusing on composting wet waste right in the apartment complexes. Apparently, they're even giving residents subsidies to buy composting bins!

unnormalised: That's a step in the right direction, right? But the truth is, only a fraction of India's waste is actually processed. We're talking mountains of plastic ending up in landfills kilometers away from our cities.
normalised: That's a step in the right direction, right? But the truth is, only a fraction of India's waste is actually processed. We're talking mountains of plastic ending up in landfills kilometers away from our cities.

unnormalised: Experts are saying that we need to think circular – reducing, reusing, and recycling. It's not just about cleaning up; it's about changing our consumption habits.
normalised: Experts are saying that we need to think circular – reducing, reusing, and recycling. It's not just about cleaning up; it's about changing our consumption habits.

unnormalised: So, next time you're about to toss that plastic bottle, think twice! Maybe it can be repurposed. Every little bit helps, yaar! Let's make Bharat Swachh!
normalised: So, next time you're about to toss that plastic bottle, think twice! Maybe it can be repurposed. Every little bit helps, yaar! Let's make Bharat Swachh!
